title: Authors and Citation
text: Comai G (2026). plausibler: Access Plausible Analytics API. R package version 0.1.7.9003, https://giocomai.github.io/plausibler/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plausibler: Access Plausible Analytics API},   author = {Giorgio Comai},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.7.9003},   url = {https://giocomai.github.io/plausibler/}, }

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: plausibler wrapper R programming language Plausible Analytics API. facilitates making queries, getting tidy data frames return. See Plausible Analytics API documentation details API, endpoints, etc.

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: package originally built targeting Plausible API version 1. documentation Plausible’s website refers API version 2. set new functions introduced facilitate interactions API v2, particular pa2_get() pa2_df(). See relevant examples documentations functions. structured documentation examples workflows added due time.

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: can install plausibler r-universe : GitHub : facilitate interactive use auto-complete, function starts “pa_” (“Plausible Analytics”) followed verb describing function .

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: beginning session, need set base url Plausible Analytics instance (self-hosted, https://plausible.io/), site_id (domain website), API key. three main options get data API. know exactly query, can just go . can e.g. see monthly stats last six months : Keep mind still need set key pa_set(). Replace $SITE_ID domain example, check official API documentation many examples. prefer stick syntax closer typically use R, can achieve following: Finally, can use wrapper functions, don’t need remember endpoint. example time series data: example breakdown stats: interested metrics, see: , say, combining properties, metrics, filters, see referrers visits given page: possible query custom periods: also possible get aggregate stats:
code: pa_set(   base_url = "https://plausible.io/",   site_id = "example.com",   key = "actual_key_here" ) pa_get(full_url = "https://plausible.io/api/v1/stats/timeseries?site_id=$SITE_ID&period=6mo") pa_get(   endpoint = "/api/v1/stats/timeseries",   parameters = list(period = "6mo") ) pa_get_timeseries(period = "6mo") pa_get_timeseries(period = "30d") pa_get_timeseries(period = "custom&date=2021-06-01,2021-06-07") pa_get_breakdown(period = "30d", property = "event:page")  # which is exactly the same as: pa_get_top_pages() pa_get_breakdown(   period = "30d",   property = "event:page",   metrics = c(     "visitors",     "pageviews",     "bounce_rate",     "visit_duration"   ),   limit = 1000 ) pa_get_breakdown(   period = "6mo",   property = "visit:referrer",   metrics = c(     "visitors",     "pageviews",     "bounce_rate",     "visit_duration"   ),   limit = 1000,   filters = list(`event:page` = "/example/") ) pa_get_breakdown(   period = "custom&date=2023-04-01,2023-06-30",   property = "event:page" ) pa_get_aggregate()

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: breakdown multiple properties natively implemented API, plausibler offers convenience function tries achieve result repeated queries, iterating occurrence property given date. following get number visitors source page date last week. Depending number “sources” recorded, likely slow. order speed process reduce load API, default function caches data SQLite database created within current working directory. data full days cached (.e. ’s safer include current date, even enforced).

title: Access Plausible Analytics API
text: wrapper functions maybe, extensive local caching sqlite suggestions? Open issue

title: Transform API response from list to data frame — pa2_df

title: Transform API response from list to data frame — pa2_df
Transform API response from list to data frame — pa2_df
text: response_l list based Plausible API v2 response, typically retrieved pa2_get(). long Logical, defaults FALSE. FALSE, default, value metric returned column. TRUE, data frame returned long format.

title: Transform API response from list to data frame — pa2_df
text: data frame.

title: Transform API response from list to data frame — pa2_df
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pa2_get(   date_range = "7d",   metrics = c("visits", "pageviews"),   dimensions = c("time:day"),   pagination = list(limit = 10) ) |>   pa2_df(long = TRUE)   pa2_get(   date_range = "7d",   metrics = c("visits", "pageviews"),   dimensions = c("time:day"),   pagination = list(limit = 10) ) |>   pa2_df(long = FALSE) } # }

what: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
text: details, consult official documentation.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
code: pa2_get(   date_range = "30d",   metrics = "visits",   dimensions = NULL,   filters = NULL,   order_by = NULL,   include = NULL,   pagination = NULL,   site_id = NULL )

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
text: date_range character vector length 1, list two dates times. Valid values include: "day", "7d", "28d", "30d", "91d", "month", "6mo", "12mo", "year", "". Custom date ranges can given list two dates e.g. list("2024-01-01", "2024-07-01"). See examples, official documentation details. filters Optional, defaults NULL. given, must list three (operator, dimension, clauses) four (operator, dimension, clauses, modifiers) elements. See examples. details, see API documentation filtering.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
text: named list, three elements: results, meta, query.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API (v2) — pa2_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pa2_get(   date_range = "30d",   metrics = "visits" )  pa2_get(   date_range = "7d",   metrics = c("visits", "visitors"),   dimensions = c("time:day", "event:page"),   include = list(total_rows = TRUE) )    ## Customise number of results and explore pagination pa2_get(   date_range = "7d",   metrics = c("visits", "visitors"),   dimensions = c("time:day", "event:page"),   include = list(total_rows = TRUE),   pagination = list(limit = 10,                     offset = 0) # increase offset to get following pages ) ## Date range between dates pa2_get(   date_range = list(Sys.Date() - 8, Sys.Date() - 1),   metrics = c("visits", "visitors"),   dimensions = c("time:day", "event:page") )   ## Notice that filters require nested lists, even if they are simple  pa2_get(   date_range = list(Sys.Date() - 2, Sys.Date() - 1),   metrics = c("visits", "visitors"),   dimensions = c("time:day", "event:page"),   include = list(total_rows = TRUE),   filters = list(     list(       "is_not",       "visit:country_name",       list(         "China"       )     )   ) ) } # }

what: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
text: details, consult official documentation.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
code: pa_get(endpoint, parameters = NULL, filters = NULL, full_url = NULL)

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
text: endpoint Endpoint described official documentation, e.g. "/api/v1/stats/timeseries". parameters named list parameters (see example). want run complex queries can leave NULL, include whole call (Plausible instance URL, endpoint, query) parameter full_url. filters Optional, defaults NULL. given, must given form "visit:browser==Firefox;visit:country==FR", named vector (see examples). Use ";" separate multiple filtering criteria. details, see API documentation filtering reference. full_url Defaults NULL. given, takes precedence parameters well settings. See examples, well examples official documentation.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
text: data frame (tibble) results.

title: Gets data from Plausible Analytics API — pa_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pa_get(   endpoint = "/api/v1/stats/timeseries",   parameters = list(period = "6mo") )  # Same as above, but with full_url: # N.B. You still need to set the key with pa_set(). Replace $SITE_ID with your domain pa_get(full_url = "https://plausible.io/api/v1/stats/timeseries?site_id=$SITE_ID&period=6mo") } # }

what: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
title: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
text: Get breakdown stats given property

title: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
code: pa_get_breakdown(   period = "30d",   property = "event:page",   metrics = "visitors",   limit = 100,   filters = NULL )

title: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
text: period Period include analysis, defaults "30d". See examples well time-dimensions section official documentation valid values. property Property break stats . full list available properties, see properties section official documentation. metrics Default "visitors". Can set, example, c("visitors", "pageviews", "bounce_rate", "visit_duration"). full list available metrics description, see metrics section official documentation. limit Limit number results. Maximum value 1000. Defaults 100. want get 1000 results, can make multiple requests paginate results specifying page parameter (e.g. make request page=1, page=2, etc) filters Optional, defaults NULL. given, must given form "visit:browser==Firefox;visit:country==FR", named vector (see examples). Use ";" separate multiple filtering criteria. details, see API documentation filtering reference.

title: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
text: data frame.

title: Get a breakdown of stats by a given property — pa_get_breakdown
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ pa_get_breakdown(period = "30d", property = "event:page")  ## With filters, e.g. to see all referrers to the given url:  pa_get_breakdown(   period = "30d",   property = "visit:referrer",   filters = list(`event:page` = "/berlin/") ) } # }

what: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
text: facilitates caching daily stats.

title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
code: pa_get_breakdown_by_date(   property = "event:page",   metric = "visitors",   start_date = Sys.Date() - 8,   end_date = Sys.Date() - 1,   limit = 1000,   cache = TRUE,   wait = 0.1 )

title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
text: start_date Earliest day include output. Defaults 8 days ago order include last full week data. Date expected format "YYYY-MM-DD", either character Date. end_date recent day include output. Defaults yesterday order include last full week data. Date expected format "YYYY-MM-DD", either character Date. limit Defaults 1000, reduce need pagination, currently supported. cache Defaults TRUE. TRUE, caches data local sqlite database, stored folder named website current working directory. sqlite database named chosen properties, hence problems caching data different websites different combinations properties. wait Numeric, defaults 0.1. function likely make high number requests API, small pause added request reduce load servers.  description

title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
text: data frame three columns: date, property, metric.

title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date
text: However, data can mostly retrieved efficiently using timeseries endpoint, setting optional interval parameter date (yet integrated pa_get_timeseries() function).

title: Get breakdown by date and a single property — pa_get_breakdown_by_date

text: facilitates operation natively supported API.

title: Get combined breakdown by two properties and date — pa_get_properties_by_date
code: pa_get_properties_by_date(   property1 = "visit:source",   property2 = "event:page",   start_date = Sys.Date() - 8,   end_date = Sys.Date() - 1,   property1_to_exclude = character(),   limit = 1000,   cache = TRUE,   only_cached = FALSE,   wait = 0.1 )

title: Get combined breakdown by two properties and date — pa_get_properties_by_date
text: start_date Earliest day include output. Defaults 8 days ago order include last full week data. Date expected format "YYYY-MM-DD", either character Date. end_date recent day include output. Defaults yesterday order include last full week data. Date expected format "YYYY-MM-DD", either character Date. property1_to_exclude Character vector. Useful remove irrelevant iterations. example, "Direct / None" mostly excluded using visit:source visit:referrer. limit Defaults 1000, reduce need pagination, currently supported. cache Defaults TRUE. TRUE, caches data local sqlite database, stored folder named website current working directory. sqlite database named chosen properties, hence problems caching data different websites different combinations properties. only_cached Defaults FALSE. TRUE, data cached locally retrieved. wait Numeric, defaults 0.1. function likely make high number requests API, small pause added request reduce load servers.  description

title: Get combined breakdown by two properties and date — pa_get_properties_by_date
text: data frame four columns: date, property1, property2, visitors.

title: Get combined breakdown by two properties and date — pa_get_properties_by_date
text: example, allows retrieve visit:source event:page date. supported API, achieves result via repeated calls API: first retrieves visitors property1 (e.g. visit:source) given date, iterates , , relying filters, queries one one item resulting query (e.g. visit:source found given date). See https://github.com/plausible/analytics/discussions/1254

title: Get combined breakdown by two properties and date — pa_get_properties_by_date

title: Retrieves session settings — pa_get_settings
text: base_url base URL Plausible instance. Set https://plausible.io/ - domain self-hosted Plausible. site_id Corresponds domain website. key character string used authentication. Can retrieved user settings Plausible Analytics.

title: Retrieves session settings — pa_get_settings
text: list (invisibly).

title: Retrieves session settings — pa_get_settings
code: pa_set(   base_url = "https://plausible.io/",   site_id = "example.com",   key = "actual_key_here" )  pa_get_settings()  ## It allows to override specific settings, without changing environment variables  pa_get_settings(site_id = "notexample.com")
